Definition.WordDefinition: Softness \Soft"ness\, n. [AS. s?ftness, s?ftnyss.] The quality or state of being soft; -- opposed to {hardness}, and used in the various specific senses of the adjective. [1913 Webster]

softness n 1: the property of giving little resistance to pressure [ant: {hardness}] 2: a sound property that is free from loudness or stridency [ant: {volume}] 3: a disposition to be lenient in judging others; "softness is not something permitted of good leaders"
